verses.verse: My cry <S%H6817><s%> goes to God! <S%H430><s%> Indeed, <S%H6963><s%> I cry to God <S%H430><s%> for help, <S%H6963><s%> and for him to listen to me. <S%H238><s%>

In the day <S%H3117><s%> of my trouble <S%H6869><s%> I sought <S%H1875><s%> the Lord. <S%H136><s%> My hand <S%H3027><s%> was stretched <S%H5064><s%> out in the night, <S%H3915><s%> and didn't <S%H6313><s%> get tired. My soul <S%H5315><s%> refused <S%H3985><s%> to be comforted. <S%H5162><s%>
I remember <S%H2142><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and I groan. <S%H1993><s%> I complain, <S%H7878><s%> and my spirit <S%H7307><s%> is overwhelmed. <S%H5848><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
You hold <S%H270><s%> my eyelids <S%H5869><s%> open. <S%H8109><s%> I am so troubled <S%H6470><s%> that I can't <S%H1696><s%> speak.
I have considered <S%H2803><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> the years <S%H8141><s%> of ancient times. <S%H5769><s%>
I remember <S%H2142><s%> my song <S%H5058><s%> in the night. <S%H3915><s%> I consider <S%H7878><s%> in my own heart; <S%H3824><s%> my spirit <S%H7307><s%> diligently inquires: <S%H2664><s%>
"Will the Lord <S%H136><s%> reject <S%H2186><s%> us forever? <S%H5769><s%> Will <S%H3254><s%> he be favorable no more? <S%H7521><s%>
Has his loving kindness <S%H2617><s%> vanished <S%H656><s%> forever? <S%H5331><s%> Does his promise <S%H562><s%> fail <S%H1584><s%> for generations? <S%H1755><s%>
Has God <S%H410><s%> forgotten <S%H7911><s%> to be gracious? <S%H2589><s%> Has he, <S%H639><s%> in anger, withheld <S%H7092><s%> his compassion? <S%H7356><s%>" Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Then I thought, <S%H559><s%> "I will appeal <S%H2470><s%> to this: <S%H8141><s%> the years of the right hand <S%H3225><s%> of the Most High. <S%H5945><s%>"
I will remember <S%H2142><s%> Yah <S%H3050><s%>'s deeds; <S%H4611><s%> for I will remember <S%H2142><s%> your wonders <S%H6382><s%> of old. <S%H6924><s%>
I will also meditate <S%H1897><s%> on all your work, <S%H6467><s%> and consider <S%H7878><s%> your doings. <S%H5949><s%>
Your way, <S%H1870><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> is in the sanctuary. <S%H6944><s%> What god <S%H430><s%> is great <S%H1419><s%> like God? <S%H410><s%>
You are the God <S%H410><s%> who does <S%H6213><s%> wonders. <S%H6382><s%> You have made your strength <S%H5797><s%> known <S%H3045><s%> among the peoples. <S%H5971><s%>
You have redeemed <S%H1350><s%> your people <S%H5971><s%> with your arm, <S%H2220><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> and Joseph. <S%H3130><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

The waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> you, <S%H430><s%> God. The waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> you, <S%H2342><s%> and they writhed. The depths <S%H8415><s%> also convulsed. <S%H7264><s%>

The clouds <S%H5645><s%> poured out <S%H2229><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%> The skies <S%H7834><s%> resounded <S%H5414><s%> with thunder. <S%H6963><s%> Your arrows <S%H2687><s%> also flashed around. <S%H1980><s%>

The voice <S%H6963><s%> of your thunder <S%H7482><s%> was in the whirlwind. <S%H1534><s%> The lightnings <S%H1300><s%> lit <S%H215><s%> up the world. <S%H8398><s%> The earth <S%H8398><s%> trembled <S%H7264><s%> and shook. <S%H7493><s%>
Your way <S%H1870><s%> was through the sea; <S%H3220><s%> your paths <S%H7635><s%> through the great <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%> Your footsteps <S%H6119><s%> were not known. <S%H3045><s%>
You led <S%H5148><s%> your people <S%H5971><s%> like a flock, <S%H6629><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron. <S%H175><s%>
